column2: Be filmed feeding a baby lamb
column4: Nothing warms the hearts of voters more than seeing a politician caring for a small cute animal, as long as they look like they are comfortable and enjoying it, and the animals behaves itself. What could possibly go wrong?

column2: Attend funeral of police officer killed in line of duty
column4: Attending the funeral of a brave police officer tragically killed in the line of duty surely shows your compassionate side, as long as the grieving relatives do not mind you being there, and your presence is not perceived to be cynical, or manipulative, or just in bad taste.

column2: Give speech in church after shooting.
column4: Giving a speech about the injustice and tragedy of a shooting can make you appear extremely compassionate, as long as you do not look like you are faking your emotions or trying to turn a tragedy into a political opportunity.

Arriving rapidly on the scene after a flood, certainly shows your compassion for those people tragically affected by this event, providing that your motorcade does not slow down rescuers, and the local people are happy, and not furious to see you surveying their underwater houses.

Nothing says 'strong' as much as beating the countries special-forces experts at martial arts, providing that you do not end up looking ridiculous, break a leg, or it looks like they are deliberately letting you win.

For a strong politicians, nothing could be more natural than only finding the time for an interview during your regular exercise session, so long as you actually are fit, and can jog the length of an interview without collapsing, or drowning in sweat.

Look like you are in-control and can win against the elements by wind surfing as a photo opportunity. Nothing can go wrong, assuming there actually is enough wind, that you do actually know how to windsurf and that it doesn't look elitist and pretentious.

column2: Play in a charity football match
column4: Show off your energy and vitality by playing a harmless and fun game of football for charity. This should be easy, as long as you do actually play well and win, but don't win too much as that looks like cheating, and obviously don't cheat or play rough!

column2: Be filmed hunting with a rifle
column4: Appear strong and confident by displaying your prowess with a rifle and go hunting. Make sure you actually hit something, so you don't look incompetent, but don't kill too many things, or look like you enjoy it, or look like you don't enjoy it. Can you do that?

Show you have nothing to hide by being interviewed on a lightweight fun morning TV show that exposes the true you. Try to appear commanding, and intelligent while also down-to-earth and relatable. Serious yet also fun. Also natural, yet exceptional.

column2: Eat breakfast in a typical builders cafe
column4: Nothing could be easier, and better for showing off that you are just a regular citizen, than enjoying a nice traditional breakfast at an ordinary cafe for working people. Obviously you know what to order, and how to eat it perfectly naturally in front of 200 cameras.

column2: Be filmed watching the a sports team play
column4: As a regular citizen, obviously you are a huge fan of the country's national sport and enjoy nothing more than cheering the team on as they play. This clearly assumes you do actually follow the sport, have any idea what the rules are and the name of at least one player.

column2: Appear on a televised genealogy program
column4: A popular TV show that follows peoples ancestry will help people see the real you and understand your background. This will make you appear much more relatable, assuming no embarrassments like your ancestors turn out o be criminals, slave-dealers, or staggeringly rich.

What could be more normal than the desire to literally carve your political promises in a giant slab of stone and erect it outside the parliament building to remind everyone of your trustworthiness. This will in no way ever seem like a really mad idea.
